definition: to dismiss sth with a laugh (idiom)/to laugh it off
surname Fu
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 顯然穆加貝對此付之一笑。

sentences.english: Mark two-tone, pay the memories. One laugh.
sentences.chinese: 深淺不一的印記，付之一笑的回憶。

sentences.english: We could look at Julie and laugh at her ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以對茱麗葉的無知付之一笑。

sentences.english: Shades of mark, and laugh memories.
sentences.chinese: 深淺不一的印記，付之一笑的回憶。

sentences.english: The daring climbers laugh at danger.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的登山者對危險付之一笑。

sentences.english: He smiled at the manifest absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 他對這明顯的謬論付之一笑。

sentences.english: He laughed off the embarrassing situation.
sentences.chinese: 他對那尷尬的處境付之一笑。

sentences.english: Cartoons also make people laugh at their own personal worries.
sentences.chinese: 漫畫也使人們對個人煩惱付之一笑。

sentences.english: Most pirates just laughed and dared the countries to come stop them.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的海盜對此付之一笑，非要國家出面制止不可。

sentences.english: It is a great art to laugh at your own misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 對己之不幸付之一笑，這是一門偉大的藝術。

sentences.english: He laughed off the awkward situation!
sentences.chinese: 他對尷尬的處境付之一笑。

definition: to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
to laugh away (instead of taking seriously)
not to mind/unconcerned
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
ephemeral (idiom)
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
(literary) to smile
to pay no attention to/not to mind
to just talk for the sake of talking
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
to spread malicious gossip/also written 飛短流長|飞短流长[fei1 duan3 liu2 chang2]
